channel.title: Pages on Intro to Social Data Science
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Intro to Social Data Science

item.title: Practical info
item.description: This page contains information about the course groups as well as information on mandatory assignments and exam project. Place and time The course runs from August 05, 2024 to August 28. See timeplan for teaching schedule. All lectures and lab/exercise classes on campus will take place in CSS 35-01-05. Groups You have two options of being assigned to a group. The first is that you report the group to us and where all members consent.

item.title: Timeplan
item.description: This page contains a schedule of the teaching sessions. Most of the teaching will take place between August 5 and August 16, 2024, with additional supervision on August 20. Each day will generally contain one or two teaching sessions. Most sessions will follow the daily schedule below: Morning session (9-12): 9-10 Live lecture, 10-12 Notebook with integrated lecturing videos on technical aspects of the session + exercises Lunch break (12-13): Afternoon session (13-16): 13-14 Live lecture, 14-16 Notebook with integrated lecturing videos on technical aspects of the session + exercises Office hour, optional: varies (booking system through Google Sheets, see link in the schedule below) The complete schedule of sessions is listed below with title, lecturer and links to material.

item.title: Course readings
item.description: Textbook for general introduction to social data science: Big by Bit - Social research in the digital age by Matthew J. Salganik [BBB], free online version here. Textbooks for data science in Python Python for Data Analysis, 3rd ed. (2022) by Wes McKinney [PDA] Python Machine Learning, 3rd ed. (2019) by Sebastian Raschka & Vahid Mirjalili [PML] Preparation and Assignment 0 The course begins with your preparation for the teaching. This consists in Assignment 0 which is a learning module and assignment together.
